alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 4:51PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Torrential rainfall associated with slow moving thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Kit Carson County through 515 PM MDT... At 445 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated that as much as 1 to 2 inches of rain had fallen 17 miles north of Seibert, in vicinity of Highway 59 near the Washington county border. Additional heavy rain is possible through 515 PM MDT. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall. Ponding of water on area roads. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hazardous driving conditions. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Kit Carson County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
